content.raw:
Hi Lars,

Yes, I will need to document this all properly elsewhere, though I do think that the directions above in this thread ought to be almost sufficient. You should not need to have a compiled connection table on the remote computer, it just needs to be able to run the remote process server and to be able to import the worker class.

I'm not seeing why you would get that error. Did you by chance pass in the string `worker="GPIB_remote_worker"` instead of the object `worker=GPIB_remote_worker`? That's all I can think of that might have gone wrong so far!
content.html:
Hi Lars,

Yes, I will need to document this all properly elsewhere, though I do think that the directions above in this thread ought to be almost sufficient. You should not need to have a compiled connection table on the remote computer, it just needs to be able to run the remote process server and to be able to import the worker class.

I'm not seeing why you would get that error. Did you by chance pass in the string worker="GPIB_remote_worker" instead of the object worker=GPIB_remote_worker? That's all I can think of that might have gone wrong so far!
